018package org.tquadrat.foundation.config.ap;
019
020import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.MAINTAINED;

022import static org.tquadrat.foundation.config.ap.ConfigAnnotationProcessor.MSG_IllegalImplementation;
023import static org.tquadrat.foundation.config.ap.ConfigAnnotationProcessor.MSG_StringConverterNotCompatible;

025import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.nonNull;
026import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
027import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNotEmptyArgument;
028import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.Comparators.caseInsensitiveComparator;
029import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.format;
030import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.isEmptyOrBlank;
031import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.isNotEmptyOrBlank;

034import javax.lang.model.element.Name;
035import javax.lang.model.type.TypeMirror;

065/**
066 *  An instance of this class provides the configuration for the code
067 *  generation, and it collects the results from the different code generators.
068 *
069 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
070 *  @version $Id: CodeGenerationConfiguration.java 946 2021-12-23 14:48:19Z tquadrat $
071 *  @UMLGraph.link
072 *  @since 0.1.0
073 */
074@SuppressWarnings( {"ClassWithTooManyFields", "ClassWithTooManyMethods", "OverlyCoupledClass"} )
075@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: CodeGenerationConfiguration.java 946 2021-12-23 14:48:19Z tquadrat $" )
076@API( status = MAINTAINED, since = "0.1.0" )
077public final class CodeGenerationConfiguration
078{
079        /*------------*\
080    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
081        \*------------*/
082    /**
083     *  The base bundle name for the resource bundle if i18n support is
084     *  required.
085     *
086     *  @note   This is <i>not</i> the value but the fully qualified field name
087     *      where to find that value!
088     */
089    private String m_BaseBundleName = null;
090
091    /**
092     *  The optional base class for the new configuration bean.
093     */
094    private final TypeName m_BaseClass;
095
096    /**
097     *  The build time; this is provided by the configuration as this allows
098     *  easier testing.
099     */
100    private final Instant m_BuildTime = Instant.now();
101
102    /**
103     * The class name for the configuration bean class, without the package.
104     */
105    private final Name m_ClassName;
106
107    /**
108     * The
109     * {@link JavaComposer}
110     * instance that is used for the code generation.
111     */
112    @SuppressWarnings( "InstanceVariableOfConcreteClass" )
113    private final JavaComposer m_Composer;
114
115    /**
116     *  The processing environment.
117     */
118    private final APHelper m_Environment;
119
120    /**
121     *  The comment for the configuration file.
122     */
123    private String m_INIFileComment = null;
124
125    /**
126     *  The flag that indicates whether the configuration must exist prior to
127     *  the first open attempt.
128     */
129    private boolean m_INIFileMustExist;
130
131    /**
132     *  The path for the configuration file.
133     */
134    private Path m_INIFilePath = null;
135
136    /**
137     *  The {@code INI} file groups. The key is the name of the group, the
138     *  value is the respective comment for the group.
139     */
140    private final Map<String,String> m_INIGroups = new TreeMap<>();
141
142    /**
143     *  The method that is provided as a source for the initialisation of the
144     *  properties of the configuration bean.
145     */
146    private MethodSpec m_InitDataMethod = null;
147
148    /**
149     * The name of the resource that is used to initialise the properties of
150     * the configuration bean.
151     */
152    private String m_InitDataResource = null;
153
154    /**
155     *  The interfaces that are extended by the configuration bean
156     *  specification.
157     */
158    private final Collection<TypeName> m_InterfacesToImplement = new HashSet<>();
159
160    /**
161     *  The message prefix for the i18n support.
162     *
163     *  @note   This is <i>not</i> the value but the fully qualified field name
164     *      where to find that value!
165     */
166    private String m_MessagePrefix = null;
167
168    /**
169     * The name of the package for the configuration bean.
170     */
171    private final Name m_PackageName;
172
173    /**
174     *  The change listener class for the {@code Preferences}.
175     */
176    private TypeName m_PreferenceChangeListenerClass;
177
178    /**
179     *  <p>{@summary The properties for the configuration bean.} The name of
180     *  the property is the key.</p>
181     */
182    private final SortedMap<String, PropertySpecImpl> m_Properties = new TreeMap<>( caseInsensitiveComparator() );
183
184    /**
185     *  The configuration bean specification.
186     */
187    private final ClassName m_Specification;
188
189    /**
190     *  The name of the preferences root node.
191     */
192    private String m_PreferencesRoot = null;
193
194    /**
195     *  A map of
196     *  {@link StringConverter}
197     *  implementations that use instances of
198     *  {@link TypeName}
199     *  as keys.
200     */
201    private final Map<TypeName,TypeName> m_StringConvertersForTypeNames;
202
203    /**
204     *  This flag indicates whether the access to the configuration bean
205     *  properties must be thread-safe.
206     */
207    private final boolean m_SynchronizeAccess;
208
209        /*--------------*\
210    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
211        \*--------------*/
212    /**
213     *  Creates an instance of {@code CodeGenerationConfiguration}.
214     *
215     *  @param  environment The access to the processing environment.
216     *  @param  composer    The
217     *      {@link JavaComposer}
218     *      instance that is used for the code generation.
219     *  @param  specification   The configuration specification, the interface
220     *      that defines the configuration bean.
221     *  @param  className   The name for the configuration bean class, without
222     *      the package name.
223     *  @param  packageName The name of the package for the configuration bean
224     *      class.
225     *  @param  baseClass   The optional base class for the new configuration
226     *      bean class.
227     *  @param  synchronizeAccess   {@code true} if the access to the
228     *      configuration bean properties should be thread safe, {@code false}
229     *      if a synchronisation/locking is not required.
230     */
231    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
232    public CodeGenerationConfiguration( final APHelper environment, final JavaComposer composer, final ClassName specification, final Name className, final Name packageName, final TypeName baseClass, final boolean synchronizeAccess )
233    {
234        m_Environment = requireNonNullArgument( environment, "environment" );
235        m_Composer = requireNonNullArgument( composer, "composer" );
236        m_ClassName = requireNotEmptyArgument( className, "className" );
237        m_PackageName = requireNonNullArgument( packageName, "packageName" );
238        m_Specification = requireNonNullArgument( specification, "specification" );
239        m_BaseClass = baseClass;
240        m_SynchronizeAccess = synchronizeAccess;
241
242        m_StringConvertersForTypeNames = initStringConvertersForTypeNames();
243    }   //  CodeGenerationConfiguration()
244
245        /*---------*\
246    ====** Methods **==========================================================
247        \*---------*/
248    /**
249     *  Adds an {@code INI} file group.
250     *
251     *  @param  name    The name for the group.
252     *  @param  comment The comment for the group.
253     */
254    public final void addINIGroup( final String name, final String comment )
255    {
256        if( isNotEmptyOrBlank( name ) )
257        {
258            if( isEmptyOrBlank( comment ) )
259            {
260                m_INIGroups.remove( name );
261            }
262            else
263            {
264                m_INIGroups.put( name, comment );
265            }
266        }
267    }   //  addINIGroup()
268
269    /**
270     *  Adds an {@code INI} file group.
271     *
272     *  @param  group   The group definition.
273     */
274    public final void addINIGroup( final INIGroup group )
275    {
276        addINIGroup( requireNonNullArgument( group, "group" ).name(), group.comment() );
277    }   //  addINIGroup()
278
279    /**
280     *  Adds some interfaces that have to be implemented by the new
281     *  configuration beam.
282     *
283     *  @param  interfacesToImplement   The classes for the interfaces to
284     *      implement.
285     */
286    public final void addInterfacesToImplement( final Collection<? extends TypeName> interfacesToImplement )
287    {
288        m_InterfacesToImplement.addAll( requireNotEmptyArgument( interfacesToImplement, "interfacesToImplement" ) );
289    }   //  addInterfaceToImplement()
290
291    /**
292     *  <p>{@summary Adds a property to the new configuration bean.}</p>
293     *  <p>If a property with the same name as the new one already exists, a
294     *  {@link CodeGenerationError}
295     *  will be thrown.</p>
296     *
297     *  @param  property    The property
298     *  @throws CodeGenerationError There is a duplicate property.
299     */
300    @SuppressWarnings( "InstanceofConcreteClass" )
301    public final void addProperty( final PropertySpec property ) throws CodeGenerationError
302    {
303        if( requireNonNullArgument( property, "property" ) instanceof PropertySpecImpl propertyImpl )
304        {
305            final var propertyName = propertyImpl.getPropertyName();
306            if( nonNull( m_Properties.put( propertyName, propertyImpl ) ) )
307            {
308                throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_DuplicateProperty, propertyName ) );
309            }
310        }
311        else
312        {
313            throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_IllegalImplementation, PropertySpec.class.getName(), property.getClass().getName() ) );
314        }
315    }   //  addProperty()
316
317    /**
318     *  Determines the implementation of
319     *  {@link StringConverter}
320     *  that can translate a String into an instance of the given type.
321     *
322     *  @param  method  The annotated method; it is only used to get the
323     *      instance of
324     *      {@link StringConversion &#64;StringConversion}
325     *      from it.
326     *  @param  type    The target type.
327     *  @return An instance of
328     *      {@link Optional}
329     *      that holds the determined class.
330     *  @throws IllegalAnnotationError  The String converter from the
331     *      annotation cannot handle the target type.
332     */
333    public final Optional<TypeName> determineStringConverterClass( final ExecutableElement method, final TypeName type ) throws IllegalAnnotationError
334    {
335        requireNonNullArgument( type, "type" );
336
337        //---* Retrieve the StringConverter from the annotation *--------------
338        final var retValue = extractStringConverterClass( method )
339            .or( () -> Optional.ofNullable( isEnumType( type ) ? TypeName.from( EnumStringConverter.class ) : m_StringConvertersForTypeNames.get( type ) ) );
340        retValue.ifPresent( stringConverter ->
341        {
342            if( !validateStringConverterClass( type, stringConverter ) ) throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_StringConverterNotCompatible, type.toString(), stringConverter.toString() ) );
343        } );
344
345        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
346        return retValue;
347    }   //  determineStringConverterClass
348
349    /**
350     *  <p>{@summary Retrieves the value for the
351     *  {@link StringConversion &#64;StringConversion}
352     *  annotation from the given method.}</p>
353     *  <p>The type for the annotation value is an instance of
354     *  {@link Class Class&lt;? extends StringConverter&gt;},
355     *  so it cannot be retrieved directly. Therefore this method will return
356     *  the
357     *  {@link TypeName}
358     *  for the
359     *  {@link StringConverter}
360     *  implementation class.</p>
361     *
362     *  @param  method  The annotated method.
363     *  @return An instance of
364     *      {@link Optional}
365     *      holding the type name that represents the annotation value
366     *      &quot;<i>stringConverter</i>&quot;.
367     */
368    public final Optional<TypeName> extractStringConverterClass( final ExecutableElement method )
369    {
370        final var retValue = m_Environment.getAnnotationMirror( requireNonNullArgument( method, "method" ), StringConversion.class )
371            .flatMap( m_Environment::getAnnotationValue )
372            .map( annotationValue -> TypeName.from( (TypeMirror) annotationValue.getValue() ) );
373
374        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
375        return retValue;
376    }   //  extractStringConverterClass()
377
378    /**
379     *  Returns the name of the field that holds the base bundle name for the
380     *  resource bundle, in case i18n support is configured.
381     *
382     *  @return An instance of
383     *      {@link Optional}
384     *      holding the fully qualified field name.
385     */
386    public final Optional<String> getBaseBundleName() { return Optional.ofNullable( m_BaseBundleName ); }
387
388    /**
389     *  Returns the base class for the new configuration bean.
390     *
391     *  @return An instance of
392     *      {@link Optional}
393     *      that holds the base class.
394     */
395    public final Optional<TypeName> getBaseClass() { return Optional.ofNullable( m_BaseClass ); }
396
397    /**
398     *  Returns the build time for the new configuration bean.
399     *
400     *  @return The build time.
401     */
402    public final Instant getBuildTime() { return m_BuildTime; }
403
404    /**
405     *  Returns the name of the class for the new configuration bean.
406     *
407     *  @return The class name.
408     */
409    public final Name getClassName() { return m_ClassName; }
410
411    /**
412     *  Returns the
413     *  {@link JavaComposer}
414     *  instance that is used for the code generation.
415     *
416     *  @return The composer instance.
417     */
418    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
419    public final JavaComposer getComposer() { return m_Composer; }
420
421    /**
422     *  Returns an implementation of some utility methods for operating on
423     *  elements.
424     *
425     *  @return The element utilities.
426     */
427    public final Elements getElementUtils() { return getEnvironment().getElementUtils(); }
428
429    /**
430     *  Returns the processing environment.
431     *
432     *  @return The processing environment.
433     */
434    public final APHelper getEnvironment() { return m_Environment; }
435
436    /**
437     *  Returns the comment for the {@code INI} file.
438     *
439     *  @return The comment for the configuration file.
440     */
441    public final Optional<String> getINIFileComment() { return Optional.ofNullable( m_INIFileComment ); }
442
443    /**
444     *  Returns the flag that indicates whether the configuration file must
445     *  exist before the program starts.
446     *
447     *  @return {@code true} if the file must exist already, {@code false} if
448     *      it will be created on startup.
449     *
450     * @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.INIFileConfig#mustExist()
451     */
452    public final boolean getINIFileMustExist() { return m_INIFileMustExist; }
453
454    /**
455     *  Returns the {@code INI} file path.
456     *
457     *  @return An instance of
458     *      {@link Optional}
459     *      that holds the path.
460     */
461    public final Optional<Path> getINIFilePath() { return Optional.ofNullable( m_INIFilePath ); }
462
463    /**
464     *  Returns the {@code INI} file groups.
465     *
466     *  @return The group names and the related comments.
467     */
468    public final Map<String,String> getINIGroups() { return Map.copyOf( m_INIGroups ); }
469
470    /**
471     *  Returns the method that is provided as a source for the initialisation
472     *  of the properties of the configuration bean.
473     *
474     *  @return An instance of
475     *      {@link Optional}
476     *      that holds the method.
477     */
478    public final Optional<MethodSpec> getInitDataMethod() { return Optional.ofNullable( m_InitDataMethod ); }
479
480    /**
481     *  Returns the name of the resource that is used to initialise the
482     *  properties of the configuration bean.
483     *
484     *  @return An instance of
485     *      {@link Optional}
486     *      that holds the resource name.
487     */
488    public final Optional<String> getInitDataResource() { return Optional.ofNullable( m_InitDataResource ); }
489
490    /**
491     *  Returns the interfaces that have to be implemented by the new
492     *  configuration bean.
493     *
494     *  @return The interfaces to implement.
495     */
496    public final Collection<TypeName> getInterfacesToImplement() { return List.copyOf( m_InterfacesToImplement ); }
497
498    /**
499     *  Returns the name of the field that holds the message prefix, in case
500     *  i18n support is configured.
501     *
502     *  @return An instance of
503     *      {@link Optional}
504     *      holding the fully qualified field name.
505     */
506    public final Optional<String> getMessagePrefix() { return Optional.ofNullable( m_MessagePrefix ); }
507
508    /**
509     *  Returns the name of the package for the new configuration bean.
510     *
511     *  @return The package name.
512     */
513    public final Name getPackageName() { return m_PackageName; }
514
515    /**
516     *  <p>{@summary Returns the class for the {@code Preferences} change
517     *  listener.} If no listener class is defined, the change listener support
518     *  for the {@code Preferences} will be omitted.
519     *
520     *  @return An instance of
521     *      {@link Optional}
522     *      that holds the listener class.
523     *
524     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.PreferencesRoot#changeListenerClass()
525     */
526    public final Optional<TypeName> getPreferenceChangeListenerClass()
527    {
528        final var retValue = Optional.ofNullable( m_PreferenceChangeListenerClass );
529
530        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
531        return retValue;
532    }   //  getPreferenceChangeListenerClass()
533
534    /**
535     *  Returns the name for the {@code Preferences} root node.
536     *
537     *  @return The name for the {@code Preferences} root node.
538     *
539     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.PreferencesRoot#nodeName()
540     */
541    public final String getPreferencesRoot()
542    {
543        final var retValue = isNotEmptyOrBlank( m_PreferencesRoot) ? m_PreferencesRoot : m_Specification.canonicalName();
544
545        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
546        return retValue;
547    }   //  getPreferencesRoot()
548    /**
549     *  Returns the property with the given name.
550     *
551     *  @param  propertyName    The name of the property.
552     *  @return An instance of
553     *      {@link Optional}
554     *      that holds the retrieved property.
555     */
556    public final Optional<PropertySpec> getProperty( final String propertyName )
557    {
558        final Optional<PropertySpec> retValue = Optional.ofNullable( m_Properties.get( requireNotEmptyArgument( propertyName, "propertyName" ) ) );
559
560        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
561        return retValue;
562    }   //  getProperty()
563
564    /**
565     *  Returns the configuration bean specification.
566     *
567     *  @return The configuration bean specification.
568     */
569    public final ClassName getSpecification() { return m_Specification;}
570
571    /**
572     *  Returns the flag that controls whether the generated code for the
573     *  access to the configuration bean properties has to be thread-safe.
574     *
575     *  @return {@code true} if synchronisation/locking is required,
576     *      {@code false} if not.
577     */
578    public final boolean getSynchronizationRequired() { return m_SynchronizeAccess; }
579
580    /**
581     *  Checks whether a property with the given name does already exist.
582     *
583     *  @param  propertyName    The name of the property.
584     *  @return {@code true} if the property with the given name already
585     *      exists, {@code false} otherwise.
586     */
587    public final boolean hasProperty( final String propertyName ) { return m_Properties.containsKey( propertyName ); }
588
589    /**
590     *  Checks whether the given interface must be implemented by the new
591     *  configuration bean.
592     *
593     *  @param  interfaceToImplement    The class for the interface that has to
594     *      be implemented.
595     *  @return {@code true} if the given interface must be implemented,
596     *      {@code false} otherwise.
597     */
598    public final boolean implementInterface( final TypeName interfaceToImplement )
599    {
600        final var retValue = m_InterfacesToImplement.contains( requireNonNullArgument( interfaceToImplement, "interfaceToImplement" ) );
601
602        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
603        return retValue;
604    }   //  implementInterface()
605
606    /**
607     *  Checks whether the given interface must be implemented by the new
608     *  configuration bean.
609     *
610     *  @param  interfaceToImplement    The class for the interface that has to
611     *      be implemented.
612     *  @return {@code true} if the given interface must be implemented,
613     *      {@code false} otherwise.
614     */
615    public final boolean implementInterface( final Type interfaceToImplement )
616    {
617        final var element = TypeName.from( interfaceToImplement );
618        final var retValue = implementInterface( element );
619
620        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
621        return retValue;
622    }   //  implementInterface()
623
624    /**
625     *  Initialises the internal attribute
626     *  {@link #m_StringConvertersForTypeNames}.
627     *
628     *  @return The map of
629     *      {@link StringConverter}
630     *      implementations.
631     */
632    private static final Map<TypeName,TypeName> initStringConvertersForTypeNames()
633    {
634        final Map<TypeName,TypeName> buffer = new HashMap<>();
635
636        for( final var c : StringConverter.list() )
637        {
638            final var container = StringConverter.forClass( c );
639            if( container.isPresent() )
640            {
641                final var stringConverterClass = TypeName.from( container.get().getClass() );
642                final var key = TypeName.from( c );
643                buffer.put( key, stringConverterClass );
644            }
645        }
646
647        final var retValue = Map.copyOf( buffer );
648
649        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
650        return retValue;
651    }   //  initStringConvertersForTypeNames()
652
653    /**
654     *  Determines whether the given instance of
655     *  {@link TypeName}
656     *  is for an {@code Enum} type.
657     *
658     *  @param  typeName    The {@code TypeName} to check.
659     *  @return {@code true} if the given type is an {@code Enum} type,
660     *      {@code false} otherwise.
661     */
662    public final boolean isEnumType( final TypeName typeName )
663    {
664        var retValue = false;
665        if( requireNonNullArgument( typeName, "typeName" ) instanceof ClassName className )
666        {
667            try
668            {
669                final var candidateClass = Class.forName( className.canonicalName(), false, getClass().getClassLoader() );
670                retValue = candidateClass.isEnum();
671            }
672            catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final ClassNotFoundException e )
673            {
674                retValue = false;
675            }
676        }
677
678        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
679        return retValue;
680    }   //  isEnumType()
681
682    /**
683     *  Returns an
684     *  {@link java.util.Iterator}
685     *  over the defined properties.
686     *
687     *  @return The iterator.
688     */
689    public final Iterator<PropertySpec> propertyIterator()
690    {
691        final var iterator = m_Properties.values().iterator();
692        final Iterator<PropertySpec> retValue = new Iterator<>()
693        {
694            /**
695             *  {@inheritDoc}
696             */
697            @Override
698            public final boolean hasNext() { return iterator.hasNext(); }
699
700            /**
701             *  {@inheritDoc}
702             */
703            @Override
704            public final PropertySpec next() { return iterator.next(); }
705        };
706
707        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
708        return retValue;
709    }   //  propertyIterator()
710
711    /**
712     *  Sets the i18n parameters.
713     *
714     *  @param  messagePrefix   The message prefix.
715     *  @param  baseBundleName  The name of the base bundle.
716     */
717    public final void setI18NParameters( final String messagePrefix, final String baseBundleName )
718    {
719        m_MessagePrefix = messagePrefix;
720        m_BaseBundleName = baseBundleName;
721    }   //  setI18NParameters()
722
723    /**
724     *  Sets the configuration for the {@code INI} file.
725     *
726     *  @param  path    The path; can be {@code null}.
727     *  @param  flag    The flag that indicates whether the configuration file
728     *      must exist before the program starts.{@code true} if the file must
729     *      exist, {@code false} if it will be created on startup.
730     *  @param  comment The comment; can be {@code null}.
731     */
732    public final void setINIFileConfig( final Path path, final boolean flag,  final String comment )
733    {
734        m_INIFilePath = path;
735        m_INIFileComment = isNull( m_INIFilePath ) ? null : comment;
736        m_INIFileMustExist = flag;
737    }   //  setINIFileConfig()
738
739    /**
740     *  Set the method that is provided as a source for the initialisation of
741     *  the properties of the configuration bean.
742     *
743     *  @param  method  The method; can be {@code null}.
744     */
745    public final void setInitDataMethod( final MethodSpec method ) { m_InitDataMethod = method; }
746
747    /**
748     *  Set the name of the resource that is used to initialise the
749     *  properties of the configuration bean.
750     *
751     *  @param  initDataResource    The resource name; can be {@code null}.
752     */
753    public final void setInitDataResource( final String initDataResource ) { m_InitDataResource = initDataResource; }
754
755    /**
756     *  Sets the class for the {@code Preferences} change listener.
757     *
758     *  @param  listenerClass   The listener class; can be {@code null}.
759     *
760     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.PreferencesRoot#changeListenerClass()
761     */
762    public final void setPreferenceChangeListenerClass( final TypeName listenerClass )
763    {
764        m_PreferenceChangeListenerClass = listenerClass;
765    }   //  setPreferenceChangeListenerClass()
766
767    /**
768     *  Sets the name for the preferences root node.
769     *
770     *  @param  name    The name for the preferences root node.
771     */
772    public final void setPreferencesRoot( final String name )
773    {
774        m_PreferencesRoot = requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" );
775    }   //  setPreferencesRoot()
776
777    /**
778     *  Validates whether the provided implementation of
779     *  {@link StringConverter}
780     *  can be used to translate a String into an instance of the given target
781     *  type.
782     *
783     *  @param  targetType  The target type.
784     *  @param  stringConverterClass    The
785     *      {@link TypeName }
786     *      for the implementation of
787     *      {@link StringConverter}.
788     *  @return {@code true} if the string converter works for the target type,
789     *      {@code false} otherwise.
790     */
791    @SuppressWarnings( "NestedTryStatement" )
792    public final boolean validateStringConverterClass( final TypeName targetType, final TypeName stringConverterClass )
793    {
794        requireNonNullArgument( targetType, "targetType" );
795
796        var retValue = false;
797        if( stringConverterClass instanceof ClassName className )
798        {
799            try
800            {
801                final var candidateClass = Class.forName( className.canonicalName(), false, getClass().getClassLoader() );
802                if( candidateClass.isInstance( StringConverter.class ) )
803                {
804                    /*
805                     * We need the fromString() method from the converter; more
806                     * precisely, we need the type of the return value for that
807                     * method. We do not regard a potentially existing method
808                     * getSubjectClass() on the StringConverter class.
809                     */
810                    try
811                    {
812                        final var fromStringMethod = candidateClass.getMethod( "fromString", CharSequence.class );
813                        final var returnType = TypeName.from( fromStringMethod.getReturnType() );
814                        retValue = returnType.equals( targetType );
815                    }
816                    catch( final NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException e )
817                    {
818                        throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_IllegalImplementation, StringConverter.class.getName(), className.canonicalName() ), e );
819                    }
820                }
821            }
822            catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final ClassNotFoundException e ) { /* Deliberately ignored */ }
823        }
824
825        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
826        return retValue;
827    }   //  validateStringConverterClass()
828}
829//  class CodeGenerationConfiguration
830
831/*
832 *  End of File
833 */
